0.user_question: John had a son James when he was 19.  James is now twice as old as his sister Dora, who will turn 12 in 3 years.  How old will John's youngest son, who was born when John was 707123, be in 3 years?

subanswer.text: Let's think step by step. John was 19 when James was born. Dora is 12 now and will turn 15 in 3 years. When she turns 15, James will be twice as old. Let's call James' age at that time X. Then 15 - X = 12 * 2 = 24. X + 24 = 15. X is 3 years less than X + 24. So X - 3 = 12. X is 3 more than 9. X is 12. The answer is: 12.
